thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Monday, 05 Mar 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: BOJ deputy governor nominee Amamiya: benefits of easy policy outweigh cost

author: Reuters Editorial
title: BOJ deputy governor nominee Amamiya: benefits of easy policy outweigh cost
text:
TOKYO (Reuters) - Bank of Japan Executive Director Masayoshi Amamiya said on Monday the benefits of the central bank’s massive monetary stimulus were outweighing the side effects.
Masayoshi Amamiya, a nominee for Bank of Japan deputy governor, attends a confirmation hearing in the lower house of parliament in Tokyo Japan March 5, 2018. REUTERS/Toru Hanai Amamiya, a nominee for one of the two BOJ deputy governor posts, told a confirmation hearing in parliament’s lower house that the bank would scrutinize the costs and benefits in guiding monetary policy.
Reporting by Leika Kihara and Tetsushi Kajimoto; Editing by Chris Gallagher
